result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vanessa Delray Fernandez

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez not in court.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Vanessa Delray Fernandez.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF96 and 22CF5.  22CF96 is scheduled as an initial appearance State has not been able to serve.  Attorney stated def should be on the way to the court house, spoke to def about 30 to 45 minutes ago.  Back on the record at 2:23.  Def appears in person.  22CF5 here for STC. 22CF96 is not representing on that case, asking to go to office to see if qualifies and will take.  PO Box 264 Ashland Wi.  No residential address.  Attorney has not received criminal compliant in 22CF96, copy of compliant given to def.  Status of 22CF5, offer is extended not accepted asking to set trial dates.  State comments a 2 day trial.  Scheduling Order. January 24th and 25th #2 spot.  
22CF96 Ruth Kressel comments on conditions of release.  Court orders $5000 signature bond and ABSOL.  Def needs to go reapply at PD for 22CF96.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 25, 2023 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 24, 2023 at 08:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
09:09 AM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez in court with attorney Richard Lance Jones.  David V. Meany appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. Atty read compl, atty has not talked with the def. Parties will go in a breakout room. Back on the record (9:17am) Will have init today. Rec'd compl, waives reading, pleads NG on mism counts, would like a prelim, will waive TL for prelim at this time. Ct finds the def know and vol waives TL for the prelim.
If the def appears by ZOOM she either needs to appear by video or stipulation to Identification.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:04 AM - Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez not in court. Prosecuting Atty David V. Meany appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richard Lance Jones appeared by video means for Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez.  COVID - ZOOM; Atty ? the NOH's that were sent, def maybe thinking dte is tomorrow.  Ct not satisfied def rec'd notice.  But notes she has Ct in Douglas Co & did call.  Ct will still adj todays hring.  Parties may ZOOM next dte.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Going to court in Douglas co today at 10am as well as Ashland County case at 10am. Might be a few min's late calling into the Ashland Co's Zoom.
Atty Jones called & has another hring at 10 am in another Co, adv'ing Ct will try to make this hring ASAP.
Def was given new court that had 4/26 and not 4/25 on notice of hearing. Mailed corrected NOH to def at 10:58am and called def, but no answer and VM was not set up.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Ct does not know if the def is in treatment, was given permission to appear by zoom today. 
Ct will order warrant, the def can post $100 in lieu of arrest and appear at the next intake for Ashland Co. 
If atty can get ahold of def and she is in treatment, ct will schd a hearing in intake to cancel warrant.
